# Announcements

## Plotathon Workshop

## Monday 11/10

Class cancelled on Monday (11/10) due to Veteran's Day

Watch the voicethread related to Sampling Distributio and be prepared for class.

# Exam 2 Review

## Exam 2 Information

Upcoming Wednesday/Thursday in your assigned class time.

Topics Include: Linear and Logistic Regression

## Exam 2 Rules

- You will have 75 minutes to complete it.
- You will need to be in person to receive credit for the exam.
- It is open book
- It is open note
- It is open internet
- You are not allowed to use any AI
- You are not allowed to communicate with anyone during exam in any way.
- You will need to submit the exam by the end of class time to consider it on time.


## Linear Regression

-   Fitting Models

-   Interpreting Results

    -   Numerical Predictors
    -   Categorical Predictors

-   Prediction

## Logistic Regression

-   Fitting Models

-   Interpreting Results  

    -   Numerical Predictors
    -   Categorical Predictors

-   Prediction


## Regression

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column}
**Linear Regression**

- Outcome is a number

:::

::: {.column}
**Logistic Regression**

- Outcome is 2 categories

:::
::::

## Outcome versus predictors

Read the problem carefully

## Linear Regression

Interpret the slope as is!

## Logistic Regression

Exponentiate the slope an interpret the odds ratio!

## Identify Data Type

Use the `glimpse()` function.

## Numerical Predictor

Interpret as a regular math slope.

::: callout-note

### Interpretation

As x increases by 1 unit, y increases/decreases by an **average** of **b** (coefficients) units
:::

## Categorical Predictor

Interpret slope in comparison to reference category.

::: callout-note

### Interpretation

When the category is x, y is an average of **b** units higher/lower than the reference category.  

:::

## Common Mistakes

- Using the incorrect model

- Incorrect interpretation

## Any Questions

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
